definition: to get sth done once and for all
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
forever/always/perpetual
to escape/leisurely/outstanding

sentences.english: More and more brides select tea length wedding ceremony dresses once and for all motives.
sentences.chinese: 越來越多的新娘選擇茶長度婚禮禮服一勞永逸的動機。

sentences.english: See if you can handle this young trouble-maker once and for all .
sentences.chinese: 看看你能不能把那個小搗亂分子一勞永逸的打發走。

sentences.english: This is not an one-time event.
sentences.chinese: 這並非一件一勞永逸的事情。

sentences.english: We have solved this problem once for all.
sentences.chinese: 我們已經一勞永逸地解決了這個問題。

sentences.english: See if you can handle this young trouble-maker once and for all.
sentences.chinese: 看看你能不能把那個小搗亂分子一勞永逸的打發走。

definition: to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
only when absolutely essential (idiom); as a last resort
it will cause no end of trouble (idiom)
like a swarm of bees/everyone swarms around pushing and shouting/a hornet's nest
complete nonsense (idiom)
unexpected misfortune/unexpected accident/sudden death
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
to shrink back/to flinch
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
requirement/necessary condition (math)
to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
to profit from a disaster (idiom); some good comes out of a setback/It's an ill wind that blows nobody any good.
supplementary cash reserve/private fund/private hoard/slush fund
to make progress/progress
superstructure
to squander money/to spend extravagantly
